title: Watch

verbs: To measure or record the time, duration, or rate of.
Measure the time or duration of an event or action or the person who performs an action in a certain period of time
To measure the amount of time an object takes to complete a course (e.g., "to clock a race car").
nouns: A watch is a small timepiece intended to be carried or worn by a person, so as to make the time immediately and conveniently available.
A portable or wearable timepiece worn connected to a band around the wrist.
A clock is an instrument to indicate, keep, and co-ordinate time.
A timepiece that shows the time of day
An instrument used to measure or keep track of time.
Instrument to measure or keep track of time.
An instrument used to measure or keep track of time; a non-portable timepiece.

description:
A wristwatch, as used for telling time. Appearance varies across platforms, but widely depicted as an analog timepiece with a white face and brown or black straps.

Used for various content concerning time, including watches as accessories. Apple's design is an Apple Watch, though previously featured a traditional watch before the product’s release.
apple_vendor_description: Apple's watch emoji is a sleek, modern timepiece, often depicted with a minimalist face and a smooth, metallic band. Its design boasts Apple's signature glossy 3D shading and realistic lighting, giving it a polished and sophisticated appearance, as if ready to be worn. On Apple devices, this emoji symbolizes punctuality, time management, important appointments, or even a nod to the Apple Watch itself, conveying a sense of efficiency and style.
